dict.string: View and manage a sequence of files

cat << EOF
<?xml version="1.0"?> <items> <item uid="play" arg="play" valid="yes" autocomplete="play"> <title>Play</title> <subtitle>Play the next file in the sequence</subtitle> <icon>icon.png</icon> </item> <item uid="unwatch" arg="unwatch" valid="yes" autocomplete="unwatch"> <title>Unwatch</title> <subtitle>Mark the last viewed file as unwatched</subtitle> <icon>icon.png</icon> </item> <item uid="show" arg="show" valid="yes" autocomplete="show"> <title>Show</title> <subtitle>Quicklook at your watchlist</subtitle> <icon>icon.png</icon> </item> <item uid="edit" arg="edit" valid="yes" autocomplete="edit"> <title>Edit</title> <subtitle>Open the watchlist in your default text editor, for ordering</subtitle> <icon>icon.png</icon> </item> <item uid="blank" arg="blank" valid="yes" autocomplete="blank"> <title>Blank</title> <subtitle>Erase the watchlist</subtitle> <icon>icon.png</icon> </item> <item uid="trash" arg="trash" valid="yes" autocomplete="trash"> <title>Delete</title> <subtitle>Move your watched files to the trash</subtitle> <icon>icon.png</icon> </item> </items>
EOF
View and manage a sequence of files

if [[ "{query}" == "play" ]]; then file_to_read=$(grep --invert-match "{{WATCHED}}" watchlist.txt | head -1) open "${file_to_read}" sed -i '' "s:${file_to_read}:{{WATCHED}} ${file_to_read}:" watchlist.txt
elif [[ "{query}" == "unwatch" ]]; then file_to_read=$(grep "{{WATCHED}}" watchlist.txt | tail -1) unwatched_name=$(echo ${file_to_read} | sed 's:{{WATCHED}} ::') sed -i '' "s:{{WATCHED}} ${unwatched_name}:${unwatched_name}:" watchlist.txt
elif [[ "{query}" == "show" ]]; then qlmanage -p &>/dev/null watchlist.txt
elif [[ "{query}" == "edit" ]]; then touch watchlist.txt open watchlist.txt
elif [[ "{query}" == "blank" ]]; then rm watchlist.txt
elif [[ "{query}" == "trash" ]]; then grep "{{WATCHED}}" watchlist.txt | sed 's/{{WATCHED}} //g' | xargs -I {} mv {} ${HOME}/.Trash/ sed -i '' '/{{WATCHED}}/d' watchlist.txt
fi
